creator: chatty@bigfoot.com
text:
When requesting a byte range which starts at a bigger offset than 2GB it's 
denied with 403.

error.log states:
[<date>] [error] [client <IP>] (75)Value too large for defined data type: access 
to <filename> failed

Probably an int32 needs to converted to int64.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Apache/APR needs to be compiled with large file support.
I don't believe there is a straightforward way to do that at present on Linux,
unfortunately.

If you're building from scratch:

export CPPFLAGS="-D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64"
./configure

should get working LFS support in 2.0.49 (not 2.0.48).  Beware incompatibilities
with other libraries on your system which use a 32-bit off_t.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
jorton@redhat.com
text: Apache httpd 2.2 will have large file support.
